QuestionStatement: Assume that the economy is at full employment.  Policymakers wish to maintain the price level but want to encourage greater investment.  Which of the following combinations of monetary and fiscal policies would best achieve this goal?
In one year, spending on consumption, investment, and government purchase was equal to 103 percent of a country’s gross domestic product.  This would be possible only if
AnswerChoices: The government ran a budget surplus
The government had a balanced budget

QuestionStatement: When firms restructure their operations to decrease production costs, the aggregate supply curve, the price level, and real output will change in which of the following ways?

An economy is in a short-run equilibrium at a level of output.  If there were no fiscal or monetary policy interventions, which of the following changes in output and the price level would occur in the long run?

Assume that the world operates under a flexible exchange rate system.  If the central bank of Mexico increases its money supply but other countries do not change theirs, Mexico’s inflation rate and the international value of Mexican peso will most likely change in which of the following ways?
The Federal Reserve decreases the federal funds rate by
AnswerChoices: Selling government bonds on the open market
Buying government bonds on the open market

QuestionStatement: Based on the information in the table above, what is the unemployment rate for Country X?
Suppose that the government decreases taxes and at the same time the central bank decreases the discount rate.  The combined actions will result in
AnswerChoices: An increase in unemployment and a decrease in the interest rate
An increase in unemployment and an increase in the interest rate
An increase in the real gross domestic product and a decrease in the interest rate
An increase in the real gross domestic product and an increase in the interest rate
An increase in the real gross domestic product and an indeterminate change in the interest rate

QuestionStatement: In a closed economy with only lump-sum taxation, if the marginal propensity to consume is equal to 0.75, a $70 billion increase in government spending could cause a maximum increase in output of
Which of the following is NOT a function of fiat money?
When an economy is at full employment, which of the following will most likely create demand-pull inflation in the short-run?
AnswerChoices: An increase in the discount rate
An increase in personal income taxes
A decrease in the real rate of interest
A decrease in the money supply

QuestionStatement: Under rational expectations, an announced expansion in the money supply will change nominal and real gross domestic products (GDP) in which of the following ways?
A decrease in labor productivity will shift the
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand curve to the right
Aggregate demand curve to the left
Long-run aggregate supply curve to the right
Short-run aggregate supply curve to the right
Short-run aggregate supply curve to the left

QuestionStatement: Suppose that all banks keep only the minimum reserve required by law and that there are no currency drains.  The legal reserve requirement is 10 percent.  If Maggie deposits the $100 bill she received as a graduation gift from her grandmother into her checking account, the maximum increase in the total money supply will be
Assuming fixed exchange rates, if country Z’s rate of inflation increases relative to its trading partners, Country Z’s imports and exports will most likely change in which of the following ways?
Which of the following household purchases will be counted as part of gross private investment in a country’s gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: a new car for personal use

QuestionStatement: An increase in aggregate demand will cause which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A movement along a given-short run Phillips curve
The long-run Phillips curve to become horizontal
The short-run Phillips curve to shift to the left
The long-run Phillips curve to shift to the right
The long-run Phillips curve to shift to the left

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would cause the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right?
AnswerChoices: An increase in the wage rate
An increase in the interest rate
An increase in the natural rate of unemployment
A decrease in the capital stock
A decrease in the expected price level

QuestionStatement: A decrease in business taxes would lead to an increase in national income by increasing which of the following?
AnswerChoices: Both aggregate demand and aggregate supply

QuestionStatement: In an open economy, an increase in government budget deficit tends to cause the international value of a country’s currency and its trade deficit to change in which of the following ways?
